reviews.review:
If one believes that a game can be art than this is a masterpiece. The gameplay is relaxed and exhilarating all at the same time. Crafted to perfectly fit any FPS gamer's like in a game. 

The story... I cant even begin to explain. It goes deep into detail and really causes you to ask questions which later get answered. Though it is hard to pick up on the real plot, you have another one to entertain you in the midst of it. Saving Elizabeth. It is like a touching romance story without the romance, but guns instead. If you are clever enough to pick up on the real story you may find yourself shedding a few tears at the end. Not just because of the story ending but also because the game is over. It certainly lasts but I wish it could keep going on forever. 

If you play a lot of FPS games, you likely already own this legendary title. But If you don't I highly recommend you pick it up as soon as possible. It is the perfect game for its genre while also taking common scenarios and throwing a whole new level of originality to it.
Böyle hikayeye can kurban
No lo he acabado y es el mejor FPS que se ha creado. La sensación de realidad atmosférica que te da, es indiscriptible.

Игра была издана аж в 13 году, как жаль, что она дошла до меня только сейчас, потрясающе атмосферная, отличный, разбитый на два мира сюжет, вызывающий дикие переживания за главных героев, восхитительная работа геймдизайнеров.
Если поближе подойти к разбору сюжета трилогии, можно понять, что сюжет в них в прямом смысле слова зациклен.
"Восторг" - именно такое ощущение вызывает эта игра.

-Букер, ты боишься Бога? 
-Нет, но тебя - боюсь.

因为现在只是打了一遍整体流程，所以很多的特别深沉的剧情都还没有发掘出来，但当伊丽莎白被抓走的时候，我并没有像是之前打一样一直在看着下面自己子弹的数量，而是一路上奔跑着，杀戮着，脑子里只剩下一个念头，把伊丽莎白还给我。

Even though I'd still reccomend this game (especially if you're a huge BioShock fan and that you where disappointed by BioShock 2), this game is honestly overrated. Yes this game has great voice acting, great visuals (if you can get it to run properly even if you have a high end PC), the skyhook was fun, and the best characters, but this does have some flaws and I don't understand why this game got 9 to 10/10s.

For starters, those handymen enemies can go @!#$ themselves for all I care, I also didn't like that you couldn't hold extra Medkits like in the first two games, instead your partner Elizabeth would hand you items you need if she can find them and I've died plenty of time because of that gameplay mechanic.

Another problem I had is that the was too short for me, I beet this on medium and it took me roughly 9 hours to beet and this game is much more linear than the first two games and it's way more cinematic so the game felt like it went by quicker than I wanted to.

"Warning this section conatins spoilers!"

And the ending was a diappointment and I'm just going to just list everything that was a problem for me
#1, this part will make you realize that Songbird was just an utter waste of a game mechanic idea
#2, the battle felt more like a part that would be in the middle of the game, not towards the end
#3, A crap-ton of info is thrown at you that makes the plot complicated like the fact the main character is also the main villian in a different reality and that Elizabeth is your daughter that was abducted by yourself from a different reality (so that does mean Comstock is technically to a certain extent Elizabeth's biological father) and that... Oh forget I'm not going to try to explain the story to you all and this video right here __ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MrCPIrs90eg __ sums up what you may be like after when you play this game.

So overall I'd say this game is just good, JUST GOOD. So no 9 or 10/10 bullcrap. More like a 7 or 8/10, but I still think you should play this game.

Lemme tell ya, there is something about firing a fully loaded machine gun whilst on a sky rail, shooting down man after man, to then slam into the ground and use return to sender, blocking everything in your path that makes you feel like a total badass. Witness! As the power of these machines of mass destruction and vigors of vitality create hell right infront of your eyes! Watch as the vigors tear away at your skin as you blast your enemies out of the sky, feel the exhiliration as you use bucking bronco, sending men into suspended mid air, only to whip out a carbine rifle and put a bullet hole straight though that smug ass vox populi rebel! Know the power, as you fire a rocket straight at an automated patriot, rip the massive chain gun from Abraham Lincolns arms, and mow down every man loyal to devil Comstick you see. Learn to appreciate the sound, as Elizabeth tosses you a fresh shotgun and listen to the seet sound of it cocking back mere seconds before you blow the head off of that fire man! Love the action, love the sights, love the story, love bishock infninte!

To start, I had played through the game on console a few years ago before I ever had a PC. 

With that said, if you are looking for a good shooter with a good story, sure get it, but if you are looking for an amazing sequal to the wonderful world theat Bioshock 1 and 2 built, well I would look elsewhere. It is a good game but far from a good Bioshock game. It does not capture teh same feel of a dark and opressive atmosphere that 1 and 2 had, it is to open and cheerful for a bioshock game. If you are an old fan of the series that is returning for another amazing title like 1 and 2, I would pass it up for another game. If you are new to bioshock, I would pass this one up in favour of 1 and 2. But if you do not really care about the great story and feel that came to so many fans of the series, get it. Like i said, this is a good game but not a good Bioshock game.
Jesus... One of the best damned games I've ever played. The world is captivating. The story grabs on and intrigues you until its beautiful ending.
I highly recommend it.

This game is a lot of fun and the DLC is well worth it, but it doesn't have much replayability. Definitely recommend paying close attention to the story and all of the details to keep up with it (even more so for the DLC)

Бодрый шутер с попытками рассказать нам сюжет. Нельзя отрицать, что тут раскрываются персонажи, повествуются их истории, но это настолько неинтересно, насколько это возможно. Спасибо, конечно, на том, что на протяжении игры нам дают новые магии, с помощью которых нам разбавляют нудный сюжет новыми механиками, которые не вписываются в столь медлительную игру. Стыдно смотреть, как разработчик навязывает историю пустых и неинтересных персонажей. 
Как плюсы, тут можно выделить сеттинг, дизайн уровней, но историю - никак нельзя. 
BioShok Infinite - типичный коридорный шутер похожий на CoD, на Doom. Кстати, на фоне последнего BioShok выглядит ущербно. Сравнивая эти две игры можно заметить, что BioShok очень медленный и такой же коридорный. В Doom'e есть несложный, в какой-то степени глуповатый сюжет, но его не ставят как главную цель в создании игры. В этом его главный плюс. В Doom стычки проходят быстрее, там нет укрытий, а BioShok на высокой сложности вы всё время будете прятаться за ними и ждать регена щита.
3 года разницы - оправдание для графики, но не для геймплея.
А история может затянуть только наивных и неискушённых людей.
4/10 - только за сеттинг.
You just kill, kill and kill in a stupid parallel universes story. I kept playing because of the positive reviews, but it doesn't get any better.
That ending

A masterpiece of a game. Recommend 100%!

PROS:
-Plays very smoothly and intuitively, combat is visceral and intense
-Vigors (basically magic) are easy and fun to use
-The skyhook/ skyrails were a lot of fun
-Tears (as in when you tear paper) added a unique gameplay element
-Performance was very good even on highest graphics settings, also loads very quickly
-Well- written plot/ dialogue
-Good voice acting
-Batshit insane setting, a lot of creativity went into this game
-Very good graphics, aside from a few rather odd-looking citizens you encounter during a non-combat part
-Unique and varied weapons + abilities, all upgradable
-Scavenging ammo/ money/ loot doesn't feel at all burdensome, I rather enjoyed it in fact
-Lots of easter eggs

CONS:
-Would have liked for a little more money to be scattered around, to buy upgrades for a couple more weapons/ vigors
-A few weapons/ vigors were introduced a little late in the game, in my opinion. 
-Above-mentioned creepy-looking civilians (not all were like this, just 2 or 3 as I remember and they were just random people in a crowd)

Pretty much a perfect game, any cons were really just my own opinion. I award this game 10/10 schmekels!!!
Increíble historia, simplemente increíble...
A mind blowing plot, I love how the story develops as well as the characters.
Great story and gameplay

PROs:
+ Great graphics. Even in 2020, the models and textures appear high-quality. Admittedly, newer games are more photorealistic, but BioShock Infinite more than makes up for it with its art style.
+ The voice acting. It's awesome! Courtnee Draper as Elizabeth is utter perfection.
+ The gameplay's fun. Unlike BioShock 1/2, Booker can only carry two weapons and two vigours at a time, so you've got to strategize what to keep and what to replace, especially since some kinds of ammunitions are scarce in some levels.
+ Fantastic story. It's less about social ideologies than the first two installments, but still deeply philosophical, especially towards the end.
+ The level design is great. Personally I prefered the retrofuturistic Rapture over the Progressive Era Columbia, but that still makes it one of the best original settings I've ever seen.
+ What impressed me quite a lot was that Elizabeth's clothes picked up wear and tear along the way. The only game I can think of (off the top of my head) that also did this is Tomb Raider. It adds a lot to immersion and realism; I hadn't expected that.

NEUTRALs:
~ My first playthrough took me about twelve hours, I think. The second only ten, years later. I didn't skip stuff in either playthroughs and always tried to explore the areas, so I would be surprised if you could break the 15h mark. 
~ There is no manual save feature, only autosave. It bothered me a lot during my first playthrough, and didn't bother me at all during my second. 

tl;dr
Great story-focused FPS with RPG elements. Wonderful characters, great story, fantastic setting. Has philosphical and SciFi elements.

DLCs:
Personally, I find the DLCs outrageously expensive. Now, in November 2020, the Season Pass was finally 75% off, lowering the price to 5€ (likely same in $), which sounds good to me. 
~ Burial at Sea Episode 1 was somewhat mediocre. It took me about 2h to finish it while exploring every nook and cranny, which isn't all that long. Rapture is admittedly beautiful, but the story lacked the flair of the basegame and felt like a bit of a rush job. Gameplay-wise it's pretty much the same as the original: Booker with his guns and plasmids, while Elizabeth unlocks doors and occasionally throws you med kits, ammo or Eve. It's not a bad DLC, but I don't feel like it added much to BioShock Infinite. 
+ Burial at Sea Episode 2 is exactly what a DLC should be. The 4h of playtime aren't exactly long but definitely sufficient to tell a wonderfully tragic and bittersweet from Elizabeth's perspective, set mostly in Rapture with a short detour to Columbia. Elizabeth plays differently compared to Booker, much more focused on stealth and sneak attacks, and the available weapons and plasmids reflect this. The story is wonderful, completing the circle from BioShock Infinite's ending to the original BioShock's beginning; it's astounding how big a role Elizabeth plays in the backgrounds.
花了12个小时通关，走走看看，结局让人震撼，虽然第一人称射击这个设定略显不足，但丝毫掩盖不了它的光辉，同时将E称作史上最给力的AI队友毫不为过。初次通关一头雾水，上网查了下人物之间的关系以及背后的历史背景，又是一个轮回与救赎的故事，很庆幸能玩到这款游戏，神作二字当之无愧。强烈建议入手，拿起武器在哥伦比亚的天空之城上演新一轮的暴力美学吧！

Damn good game.

There is so much I want to say, so this may be long which means no one will read it; but no spoilers, I promise. I really wanted this game but hesistated on getting it for a few reasons, so my only regret was not getting it sooner. It really is the best story I have ever seen in a game (granted I havent been playing long)!! We all know it is gorgeous and so fun to just wonder around for a while. Then all hell brakes loose and it becomea really fun. My biggest hesitation was - many people said the combate wasn't great (which is really important to me) but I found no issue with the combat system. My only issue was not having an inventory so if you need vigor for powers or health you better find some (ill go over why this is a big deal when we talk about the girl). The artestry in this game is oustanding, it does start out  a beautiful world but changes as you go through the game which is a nice touch. They really put a lot of thought into every part of this game including the character and even people in the background. The best part (as everyone else has always said) is Elizabeth. I wont remember everything she does but ill try.... She throws you ammo, health, vigor, money when you need it the most. She picks locks and reminds you when you've missed lock picks lying around, and of course she opens tears to other worlds which comes in handy. There is a nice navigation system - just press N then an arrow tells you which way to go. The powers are really cool and i love that the imagery each time you get a new one, its really cool. I can't image anone playing this and not liking it. I wish I could talk about the story but I won't. All I will say is it was so good the second it ended I started playing again, i only stopped to write this review while it was all fresh. I read mix reviews about the ending but I think they did a great job, it was so unquie. Its like those movies you want to watch again. While playing this again I realize there is soo many liittle things I missed, like the stuff people would say that made no sense but now it totally does. Ok, I am done. I 100% RECCOMENED EVERY PERSON PLAY THIS, THERE IS NO WAY YOU WONT ENJOY THE RIDE!!!!!!! This game absolutely deserved game of the year.
very pretty, fun gameplay, kinda short tho imo

This is my second favorite of the Bioshock games, following Bioshock 1. The storyline and setting is completely different and are spectacular. The subplots of civil unrest and the complexity of human passion are juxtaposed on the beautiful vistas of the floating city. No spoilers in this review, but the science driven plot is well done, although judging by what I hear from other players, it goes over most heads.

Muito bom, game recomendado! Zerado no Hard. Enredo sensacional, absurdamente sensacional, como já é de costume na série. Temas como viagens no tempo e multiversos são abordados (daí vem uma das possíveis interpretações do nome do jogo). A história vai fazendo mais sentido aos poucos, mas somente no último capítulo tudo é explicado e se encaixa. O tombo da cadeira é grande! Jogar o game mais uma vez (no modo desbloqueado “1999” e sem comprar itens nas máquinas de venda) vale a pena, por causa do desafio e também para rever a história e pescar os detalhes dela.
A dinâmica deste game mudou bastante em relação aos outros dois da saga. A progressão é infelizmente muito linear e conforme se avança no jogo isso se torna mais claro. O jogo alterna entre momentos de história (diálogo, interação, etc.), exploração / busca por itens e combates muito rápidos contra muitos inimigos em áreas geralmente bem grandes. 
O imenso carisma de Elizabeth e sua IA são dignas de prêmio, assim como a relação que vai sendo construída entre ela e o protagonista Booker DeWitt. Os cenários são muito bonitos, mas menos variados que nos anteriores. Os gráficos são lindos demais, não à toa o jogo ganhou a respectiva premiação no Game Awards de 2013. 
Infelizmente algumas características do gameplay que estavam presentes nos games anteriores foram ou totalmente retiradas ou “enfraquecidas” em Infinite, a saber: menor número de “plasmids” (aqui, “vigor”) em toda a série, além da relevância dos upgrades ser menor, a ponto de não dar a sensação de que um vigor “quase novo” foi obtido (como ocorria em Bioshock 2), mas apenas adicionando alguns efeitos (como em Bioshock 1); as “gene tonics” foram retiradas, substituídas em tese pelos Gears; retirada dos tipos diferentes de munições para uma mesma arma, mas manutenção de seu sistema de upgrades; mecânica de hackeamento substituída por um vigor e assim sendo, exclusão dos mini-games de hackeamento.
Concluindo, se você jogou os BioShock 1 e 2 e gostou, vai gostar desse também. Recomendo comprar a versão com Season Pass e estender muito a longevidade do game através do Clash of Clouds e o Burial at Sea. Minha nota é 10!

love the story line
Very good mindfack story. But the gameplay get's a bit boring after the mid of the game. Also the game is much more simple and linear than the first 2.

It's got a lot less backtracking than 1&2, combat is super smooth and the gunplay is really satisfying. Elizabeth is essentially a get out of jail free card because if you run out of anything it wont be long until you hear "Booker, catch!" and you get a free refill on whatever it is your missing. Never died during my whole playthrough even up on the higher difficulties. I suggest it to anyone that hasn't played 1&2 or anyone who liked 1 and hated 2.

Es gibt immer wieder außergewöhnliche Spiele. Diese Spiele verändern die Art zu spielen. Neben Spielen wie Doom, SystemShock (2), Half-Life, DeusEx… steht auch Bioshock auf dieser Liste. 

Mit Bioshock Infinite haben sich die Bioshock machen noch einmal selbst übertroffen. Ich kenne kein anderes AAA-Spiel, welches so eine intelligente Geschichte hat; welches so wunderschöne Level hat; welches so geniale Charakter hat.

Jeder Spieler sollte dieses Spiel gespielt haben. 

Tipp: Kauft unbedingt die DLCs. Burial at Sea verbindet Bioshock Infinit und Bioshock  und erzählt eine klasse Geschichte.

Bioshock Infinite is one of my favourite games, while only having 20-something hours.  The combination of excellent pacing, stunning visuals and the extraordinary character developement leads to a wonderful game which is a joy to play.  

Pick this game up on sale along with the "Lost at Sea" DLCs and it will lead you to a thrilling and thouroughly enjoyable masterpiece of a game

Ну и немного минусов этой игры.
-Тир
-Выдача Оружия и Энергетиков
-Прокачка чего либо. (Оружие,Энергетик и прочеё не равномерно. Ты находишь в начале сразу же 3 энергетика и потом половину игры ходишь без новых. Аналогично с прокачкой,до середины игры доступны 2 прокачки, а отом уже под конец овер Доху_-я.
-N_N_N_N_N_N_N_N....  Иммено так выгладить прохождение игры
-Borderlends (Кто не в курасх эта игра где везде что-то нуно собитарь. В мусорке,ящике,доме или других местах. Везде нужно смотреть и забитать лут)

I was a young child at 7 years old when I was diagnosed with stage 69 osteoporosis. I couldn’t do anything. I had a nickname called “the pineapple” and my parents tied me to a pole and ate my dog. Then, I found this app and it gave me new life and my new nickname is “the vape queen”. My parents now don’t eat my dog anymore, instead they smuggle Sour Patch Kids across the border. My life took a turn for the better and now I’m on top of the world.

评测我是比较少写的，但是玩了这款游戏后真的非常想写这篇评测！

游戏完美衔接了1、2代的剧情，剧情不得不说是非常棒的！游戏中涉及平行宇宙之类的，对于我来说剧情方面理解起来有点难，在结局看到伊丽莎白或者说是安娜把布克杀死以此结束一系列的恶性循环，我的内心是很不好受的，毕竟陪伴了伊丽莎白（安娜）,一起经历了那么多，最后却为了她要牺牲自己╯︿╰！而在结局字幕结束后（大约10分钟 ）会有一个小彩蛋——这时的康斯托克出现的几率已经消除了，只剩下未受洗礼的布克，而他回到了家中，在推开门时问了句“安娜是你吗”——我想这时的布克应该有以前的记忆，说明一切回归到了平静。

海葬第一章讲述了反派先知因不小心杀死了安娜心里愧疚，所以去了销魂城并遗忘了以前的一切，而伊丽莎白就决定去销魂城杀死先知，在结局中先知和伊丽莎白被大老爹打死了╥﹏╥...
第二章在巴黎的伊丽莎白被传送到销魂城去拯救莎莉，被反派利用在结局CG中伊丽莎白深情的雨莎莉对望最后死去。到这里这游戏的剧情也就结束了，看到这里我居然落泪了，这是到现在为止唯一一个让我心里难受的游戏，让我觉得伊丽莎白不是一个虚拟的人物而是一个真实的人，她的死真的让我很伤心。

游戏中剧情最棒的作品！而伊丽莎白死多么的真实，她的一举一动总能触及你的内心！这游戏不单单是游戏更应该是艺术品，所以《生化奇兵无限》被称为第九艺术当之无愧。

最后献上游戏中的歌曲《You Belong To Me》,顺便让我再哭会。。。

I've played all three bioshock games in succession over the last few months, having not played any previously. I got all three as part of a package sale and if you're curious, I'd certainly recommend it at the price I receieved (less than $15 total). 

In my opinion, this game was definitely the weakest in the franchise. From both a gameplay and narrative perspective, I found it lacking, in particular compared to the first game.

In general, it feels like a lot of the game mechanics have been toned down. As others have noted, Vigors feel like a lesser version of plasmids. Bizarrely, you can only carry two weapons at once rather than the wheel that was present for both weapons and plasmids in the first two games. That represents a problem in the late game on harder difficulties, where you can find yourself without a heavy weapon to take down some of the higher HP enemies. But this feels like artificial difficulty as they're easy enough if you have an RPG or Volley gun, just tough if you're with a pistol and carbine. 

I didn't really buy the story. I "get" it, just didn't feel like it was particularly well done or thought out. Though I haven't played the DLCs, I have read about them and I understand some of the bigger picture stuff. Still feels like very lazy writing to me. Certainly no character approaches the feel of an Andrew Ryan or Atlas from the first game, but that's arguably true of Bioshock 2 as well. Without giving much away, this just felt gimmicky to me and not to the standard of Bioshock 1 at all. 

Most egregiously, the level design is pretty poor, once again in comparison to the first game. What secrets there are don't feel cleverly done, just kind of tedious. I had like 30 ununsed lockpicks at the end of teh game after unlocking every door and safe. Just very bizarre. 

In conclusion, I did complete the game because I had some inertia, but I don't think I'd recommend a friend buy this one. For a shooter the bioshock franchise has never been great, but mixing in a strong story, level design, RPG elements etc. made it very very enjoyable. But I think this game marks the worst in each of those categories in the series with the exception of graphics, which are admittedly extremely good. 

So if you want a pretty shooter and this is your first entry to the series, by all means go ahead especially on sale. If you've played the first two, just know this one isn't as good.

Increible, una historia y jugabilidad muy entretenidas que te hacen querer seguir jugando, increible tercer entrega de la saga, reivindicaron lo que no lograron con el 2. Una historia nueva en el "mismo universo" de Rapture. 9/10

Weakest entry in the series, imo.

The shooting mostly consists of arenas, compared to the first and second games more believable cities, and in between those arenas there consists hallways with the occasional enemies and scripted sequences. 

Besides the fact that the game seems to be made to be extremely open ended in contrast with the claustrophobic city of Rapture, it ends up becoming even more linear and contrived. Could only recommend this for someone who wants closure on the series.

这是一部杰作。
游戏性挺不错，比较好玩。
剧情衔接点有些地方有些牵强。
但是，它的故事构思之巧妙，它想要表达的内容之深刻，作为游戏难有出其右者。
最关键的是，它塑造人物塑造的极其成功。
Elizabeth绝对是目前为止最棒的ai角色。Booker和comstock的塑造也很有韵味。Lutece兄妹就不用提了。
总之，作为游戏，除了游戏性以外，这部作品带来的享受还包括其他方面。
绝对称得上是第九艺术。
